item.title: Sherri add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "When I stand before God at the end of my life, I would hope that I would not have a single bit of talent left, and could say, 'I used everything you gave me." -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Sherri add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I believe that everything happens for a reason. People change so that you can learn to let go, things go wrong so that you appreciate them when they're right, you believe lies so you eventually learn to trust no one but yourself, and sometimes good things fall apart so better things can fall together." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Sherri add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "He had noticed that events were cowards: they didn't occur singly, but instead they would run in packs and leap out at him all at once." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Sherri add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "My fault, my failure, is not in the passions I have, but in my lack of control of them." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Sherri add a quote by Chris Cleave
item.description: "We must see all scars as beauty. Okay? This will be our secret. Because take it from me, a scar does not form on the dying. A scar means, 'I survived'." -- Chris Cleave

item.title: Sherri add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "So, this is my life. And I want you to know that I am both happy and sad and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Sherri add a quote by e. e. cummings
item.description: "The world is mud-luscious and puddle-wonderful." -- e. e. cummings

item.title: Sherri add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "You are a manipulator. I like to think of myself more as an outcome engineer." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Sherri add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "V had a passing thought that she used the word "anyway" like an eraser on a crowded chalkboard. She said it whenever she needed to clear off the things she'd just shared to make room for more." -- J.R. Ward

item.title: Sherri add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "Simple, genuine goodness is the best capital to found the business of this life upon. It lasts when fame and money fail, and is the only riches we can take out of this world with us." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Sherri add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "We do not grow absolutely, chronologically. We grow sometimes in one dimension, and not in another; unevenly. We grow partially. We are relative. We are mature in one realm, childish in another. The past, present, and future mingle and pull us backward, forward, or fix us in the present. We are made up of layers, cells, constellations." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Sherri add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Remember me and smile, for it's better to forget than to remember me and cry." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Sherri add a quote by Louis de Bernieres
item.description: "Love is a temporary madness, it erupts like volcanoes and then subsides. And when it subsides, you have to make a decision. You have to work out whether your roots have so entwined together that it is inconceivable that you should ever part. Because this is what love is. Love is not breathlessness, it is not excitement, it is not the promulgation of promises of eternal passion, it is not the desire to mate every second minute of the day, it is not lying awake at night imagining that he is kissing every cranny of your body. No, don't blush, I am telling you some truths. That is just being "in love", which any fool can do. Love itself is what is left over when being in love has burned away, and this is both an art and a fortunate accident." -- Louis de Bernieres

item.title: Sherri add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "I have a history of making decisions very quickly about men. I have always fallen in love fast and without measuring risks. I have a tendency not only to see the best in everyone, but to assume that everyone is emotionally capable of reaching his highest potential. I have fallen in love more times than I care to count with the highest potential of a man, rather than with the man himself, and I have hung on to the relationship for a long time (sometimes far too long) waiting for the man to ascend to his own greatness. Many times in romance I have been a victim of my own optimism." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Sherri add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description:
"People think a soul mate is your perfect fit, and that's what everyone wants. But a true soul mate is a mirror, the person who shows you everything that is holding you back, the person who brings you to your own attention so you can change your life.
A true soul mate is probably the most important person you'll ever meet, because they tear down your walls and smack you awake. But to live with a soul mate forever? Nah. Too painful. Soul mates, they come into your life just to reveal another layer of yourself to you, and then leave.
A soul mates purpose is to shake you up, tear apart your ego a little bit, show you your obstacles and addictions, break your heart open so new light can get in, make you so desperate and out of control that you have to transform your life, then introduce you to your spiritual master..." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Sherri add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The birds that were singing in the dew-drenched garden seemed to be telling the flowers about her." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sherri add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "I don’t think man was meant to attain happiness so easily. Happiness is like those palaces in fairy tales whose gates are guarded by dragons: we must fight in order to conquer it." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Sherri add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride: I love you in this way because I do not know any other way of loving but this, in which there is no I or you, so intimate that your hand upon my chest is my hand, so intimate that when I fall asleep your eyes close." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Sherri add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "In everyone’s life, at some time, our inner fire goes out. It is then burst into flame by an encounter with another human being. We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: Sherri add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I fell in love with her courage, her sincerity, and her flaming self respect. And it's these things I'd believe in, even if the whole world indulged in wild suspicions that she wasn't all she should be. I love her and it is the beginning of everything." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Sherri add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "We’re all a little weird. And life is a little weird. And when we find someone whose weirdness is compatible with ours, we join up with them and fall into mutually satisfying weirdness—and call it love—true love." -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: Sherri add a quote by Frederick Buechner
item.description: "Here is the world. Beautiful and terrible things will happen. Don't be afraid." -- Frederick Buechner

item.title: Sherri add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Sherri add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "History dressed up in the glow of love’s kiss turned grief into beauty." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Sherri add a quote by John Updike
item.description: "Suddenly summoned to witness something great and horrendous, we keep fighting not to reduce it to our own smallness." -- John Updike

item.title: Sherri add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Sherri add a quote by A.A. Milne
Sherri add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "If ever there is tomorrow when we're not together... there is something you must always remember. You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think. But the most important thing is, even if we're apart... I'll always be with you." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Sherri add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "How lucky I am to have something that makes saying goodbye so hard." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Sherri add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Weeds are flowers, too, once you get to know them." -- A.A. Milne
